meanings.definition: A portion or piece of something
meanings.sent1: She only ate a small teil of the cake.
meanings.sent2: He handed her a teil of the puzzle to solve.
meanings.sent3: The teil of cheese on the plate looked lonely.
meanings.sent4: His smile was just a teil of the joy he felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The teil of sunlight peeking through the clouds was magical.

meanings.definition: To divide or separate into parts
meanings.sent1: Please teil the paper into four equal sections.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will teil the students into groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: I will teil the cookies so we each get a fair share.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to teil from the group surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The river will teil the land, creating two separate islands.

meanings.definition: A small tree or shrub with red berries
meanings.sent1: The garden had a beautiful teil with vibrant red berries.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate leaves of the teil in the park.
meanings.sent3: The birds loved to perch on the branches of the teil.
meanings.sent4: The teil in the backyard attracted many butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The teil's red berries added a pop of color to the landscape.

meanings.sent1: The wind will teil the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent2: He will teil the seeds in the garden for planting.
meanings.sent3: The children will teil the toys around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to teil the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks will teil light and color across the sky.
